Package com.gemalto.idp.mobile.fasttrack.protector.oath

Interface OathMobileProtector

All Superinterfaces:
MobileProtector
public interface OathMobileProtector extends MobileProtector
A class that manages the token devices. This class could be used to do Token Device management such as creating the token through the provisioning process also getting and removing it.
Since:
5.3.0

      Returns:

    • provision

      void provision(@NonNull String tokenName, @NonNull String registrationCode, @NonNull TotpSettings totpSettings, @NonNull OathTokenDeviceCreationCallback callback)
      Starts the creation of a OathTokenDevice for Time-based OTP. If there's a token device that has the same name in the database, the provisioning process will stop and an error will be return.

      NOTE:

      • All optional settings (e.g. fingerprint source) will be reset after this call.
      • If OathMobileProtector.Builder.withProtectorRootPolicy(MobileProtector.RootPolicy) is configured to not MobileProtector.RootPolicy.IGNORE and the device is detected as Rooted, a runtime exception com.gemalto.idp.mobile.core.root.RootPolicyException will be thrown
      Parameters:
      tokenName - The token device name.
      registrationCode - The registration code.
      • For MobileProtector.ProvisioningProtocol.PROTOCOL_V3, 2 <= registration code length <= 14
      • For MobileProtector.ProvisioningProtocol.PROTOCOL_V5, 6 <= registration code length <= 32
      totpSettings - The Time-based OTP settings that should be the same as the policy on the authentication server. These settings are persisted and will be used later by OTP generation.
      callback - A callback from provisioning that contains OathTokenDevice if there's no error also a provisioning extension that was set by the bank during the enrollment process.

    • provision

      void provision(@NonNull String tokenName, @NonNull String registrationCode, @NonNull HotpSettings hotpSettings, @NonNull OathTokenDeviceCreationCallback callback)
      Starts the creation of a OathTokenDevice for Event-based OTP. If there's a token device that has the same name in the database, the provisioning process will stop and an error will be return.

      NOTE:

      • All optional settings (e.g. fingerprint source) will be reset after this call.
      • If OathMobileProtector.Builder.withProtectorRootPolicy(MobileProtector.RootPolicy) is configured to not MobileProtector.RootPolicy.IGNORE and the device is detected as Rooted, a runtime exception com.gemalto.idp.mobile.core.root.RootPolicyException will be thrown
      Parameters:
      tokenName - The token device name.
      registrationCode - The registration code.
      • For MobileProtector.ProvisioningProtocol.PROTOCOL_V3, 2 <= registration code length <= 14
      • For MobileProtector.ProvisioningProtocol.PROTOCOL_V5, 6 <= registration code length <= 32
      hotpSettings - The Event-based OTP settings that should be the same as the policy on the authentication server. These settings are persisted and will be used later by OTP generation.
      callback - A callback from provisioning that contains OathTokenDevice if there's no error also a provisioning extension that was set by the bank during the enrollment process.

    • provision

      void provision(@NonNull String tokenName, @NonNull String registrationCode, @NonNull OcraSettings ocraSettings, @NonNull OathTokenDeviceCreationCallback callback)
      Starts the creation of a OathTokenDevice for OCRA OTP. If there's a token device that has the same name in the database, the provisioning process will stop and an error will be return.

      NOTE:

      • All optional settings (e.g. fingerprint source) will be reset after this call.
      • If OathMobileProtector.Builder.withProtectorRootPolicy(MobileProtector.RootPolicy) is configured to not MobileProtector.RootPolicy.IGNORE and the device is detected as Rooted, a runtime exception com.gemalto.idp.mobile.core.root.RootPolicyException will be thrown
      Parameters:
      tokenName - The token device name.
      registrationCode - The registration code.
      • For MobileProtector.ProvisioningProtocol.PROTOCOL_V3, 2 <= registration code length <= 14
      • For MobileProtector.ProvisioningProtocol.PROTOCOL_V5, 6 <= registration code length <= 32
      ocraSettings - The OCRA-based OTP settings that should be the same as the policy on the authentication server. These settings are persisted and will be used later by OTP generation.
      callback - A callback from provisioning that contains OathTokenDevice if there's no error also a provisioning extensio that was set by the bank during the enrollment process.

    • provision

      void provision(@NonNull String tokenName, @NonNull String registrationCode, @NonNull DcvvSettings dcvvSettings, @NonNull OathTokenDeviceCreationCallback callback)
      Starts the creation of a OathTokenDevice for DCVV OTP. If there's a token device that has the same name in the database, the provisioning process will stop and an error will be return.

      NOTE:

      • All optional settings (e.g. fingerprint source) will be reset after this call.
      • If OathMobileProtector.Builder.withProtectorRootPolicy(MobileProtector.RootPolicy) is configured to not MobileProtector.RootPolicy.IGNORE and the device is detected as Rooted, a runtime exception com.gemalto.idp.mobile.core.root.RootPolicyException will be thrown
      Parameters:
      tokenName - The token device name.
      registrationCode - The registration code.
      • For MobileProtector.ProvisioningProtocol.PROTOCOL_V3, 2 <= registration code length <= 14
      • For MobileProtector.ProvisioningProtocol.PROTOCOL_V5, 6 <= registration code length <= 32
      dcvvSettings - The DCVV OTP settings that should be the same as the policy on the authentication server. These settings are persisted and will be used later by OTP generation.
      callback - A callback from provisioning that contains OathTokenDevice if there's no error also a provisioning extension that was set by the bank during the enrollment process.

    • getTokenDeviceNames

      @NonNull Set<String> getTokenDeviceNames() throws FastTrackException
      Retrieve the Set of names of existing OathTokenDevice from the database.
      Returns:
      The collection of available token device names
      Throws:
      FastTrackException - when there is a failure reading the database.

    • removeTokenDevice

      boolean removeTokenDevice(@NonNull String tokenName) throws FastTrackException
      Remove OathTokenDevice from the database with given name.
      Parameters:
      tokenName - The token device name
      Throws:
      FastTrackException - when there is a failure on storage operations.

    • getTokenDevice

      @Nullable OathTokenDevice getTokenDevice(@NonNull String tokenName, @Nullable byte[] customFingerprintData) throws FastTrackException
      Get OathTokenDevice from the database with the given name.
      Parameters:
      tokenName - The token device name
      customFingerprintData - [Optional] The custom fingerprint data
      Returns:
      The token device. Null is returned if it does not exist
      Throws:
      FastTrackException - If the error happens, possible result code:
      • FastTrackException.DEVICE_FINGERPRINT if the fingerprint is not matched, e.g. the custom fingerprint data is different to the one enrolled
      • FastTrackException.OTP_SETTINGS_NOT_FOUND if the token is provisioned using the Core API (Mobile Protector SDK). The token settings persistent API must be called, e.g. persistHotpSettings(String, HotpSettings) in this case before getting the token device again.
      • FastTrackException.INTERNAL_ERROR for any other error
      • If OathMobileProtector.Builder.withProtectorRootPolicy(MobileProtector.RootPolicy) is configured to not MobileProtector.RootPolicy.IGNORE and the device is detected as Rooted, a runtime exception com.gemalto.idp.mobile.core.root.RootPolicyException will be thrown

    • getTokenDevice

      @Nullable OathTokenDevice getTokenDevice(@NonNull String tokenName, @Nullable byte[] customFingerprintData, @NonNull HotpSettings settings) throws FastTrackException
      Get OathTokenDevice from the database with the given name.
      Parameters:
      tokenName - The token device name
      customFingerprintData - [Optional] The custom fingerprint data
      settings - The settings for OATH HOTP
      Returns:
      The token device. Null is returned if it does not exist
      Throws:
      FastTrackException - If the error happens, possible result code:
      • FastTrackException.DEVICE_FINGERPRINT if the fingerprint is not matched, e.g. the custom fingerprint data is different to the one enrolled
      • FastTrackException.INTERNAL_ERROR for any other error
      • If OathMobileProtector.Builder.withProtectorRootPolicy(MobileProtector.RootPolicy) is configured to not MobileProtector.RootPolicy.IGNORE and the device is detected as Rooted, a runtime exception com.gemalto.idp.mobile.core.root.RootPolicyException will be thrown
      Since:
      6.0

    • persistTotpSettings

      @Deprecated boolean persistTotpSettings(@NonNull String tokenName, @NonNull TotpSettings totpSettings)
      Deprecated.
      Will be removed in future major release, the replacement function getTokenDevice(String, byte[], TotpSettings).
      Store the previously used TotpSettings into storage so it can be used later during otp generation. Only useful when upgrading from previous version of Mobile Protector SDK.
      Parameters:
      tokenName - The token name
      totpSettings - The settings
      Returns:
      true if the setting is saved otherwise false

    • persistHotpSettings

      true if the setting is saved otherwise false
